1.brief: at this time, whether adverb, conjunction or expletive
to crowd; also to gash (as if by pressing into)
a daughter (used in the same wide sense as other terms of relationship, literally and figuratively)
something hemming in, i.e. (objectively) a mound (of besiegers), (abstractly) a siege, (figuratively) distress; or (subjectively) a fastness
to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

to strike (lightly or severely, literally or figuratively)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the cheek (from its fleshiness); hence, the jaw-bone
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
to judge, i.e. pronounce sentence (for or against); by implication, to vindicate or punish; by extenssion, to govern; passively, to litigate (literally or figuratively)
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity

2.brief: thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
little; (in number) few; (in age) young, (in value) ignoble
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
hence (the ox's head being the first letter of the alphabet, and this eventually used as a numeral) a thousand

properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
to go (causatively, bring) out, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively, direct and proxim.
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
a family descent; also a sewer
the front, of place (absolutely, the fore part, relatively the East) or time (antiquity); often used adverbially (before, anciently, eastward)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always

3.brief: properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
time, especially (adverb with preposition) now, when, etc.
to bear young; causatively, to beget; medically, to act as midwife; specifically, to show lineage

properly, an overhanging, i.e. (by implication) an excess, superiority, remainder; also a small rope (as hanging free)
a brother (used in the widest sense of literal relationship and metaphorical affinity or resemblance (like father))
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity

to tend a flock; i.e. pasture it; intransitively, to graze (literally or figuratively); generally to rule; by extension, to associate with (as a friend)
strength in various applications (force, security, majesty, praise)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
